channel.title: Introduction to Machine Learning 1DL034 :: 1DL034
channel.description: Webpage for assignments and lecture slides for 1DL034.

item.title: Lectures
item.author: justin.pearson@it.uu.se (Justin Pearson)
item.description: Lecture plan, timetable and link to slides.

item.title: Information on the Assignments
item.author: justin.pearson@it.uu.se (Justin Pearson)
item.description: Assignment This course has four theoretical and four practical assignments that are Python notebooks that you must complete. The practical notebooks introduce you to tools such as pandas, NumPy and scikit-learn. The theoretical notebooks help you to deepen you knowledge of some of the topics covered in the course. The assignments are available publicly on github. Project The project will be hosted on kaggle and will only available to students registered on the course. All information about the project can be found on studium.

item.title: Recommended Textbooks and Links
item.author: justin.pearson@it.uu.se (Justin Pearson)
item.description: Course Text books and other material Creating Python Virtual Environments This assumes that you are a command line person and are running Linux or MacOS. Using Python Notebooks This assumes that you are a command line person and are running Linux or MacOS. Some hints for Windows users

item.title: Exam
item.author: justin.pearson@it.uu.se (Justin Pearson)
item.description: The exam is a closed book written exam. The exam has two parts: A multiple choice section, normally of 20 questions. You have to get 80% on this part to get a 3. A second part of harder questions that require more in depth knowledge. This part of the exam is for students aiming for a 4 or a 5. Some hold exams can be found here. There are no specimen answer. If you send me your answers, then I will tell you what mark you would get, and how to improve the answer if needed.
